headline: Apple and Amazon defy expectations with latest results
summary: Tech giants Apple and Amazon have defied industry predictions with better-than-expected financial results.  Apple's success is largely thanks to record-breaking iPhone sales, while Amazon's is down to cloud computing arm Amazon Web Services (AWS), in spite of last week's outage which knocked out thousands of websites.  AWS revenue accelerated 20.2% to $33bn (almost £25bn), which CEO Andy Jassy said was a pace it hadn't seen since 2022.

content.title: Apple and Amazon defy expectations with latest results
content.summary: Tech giants Apple and Amazon have defied industry predictions with better-than-expected financial results.  Apple's success is largely thanks to record-breaking iPhone sales, while Amazon's is down to cloud computing arm Amazon Web Services (AWS), in spite of last week's outage which knocked out thousands of websites.  AWS revenue accelerated 20.2% to $33bn (almost £25bn), which CEO Andy Jassy said was a pace it hadn't seen since 2022.

headline: Amazon shares surge as AI boom drives cloud growth
summary: Amazon's share price skyrocketed by more than ten percent on Thursday after the online retail behemoth reported better than expected earnings, powered by surging demand for its cloud computing services.Amazon's major rivals in the cloud computing space, Microsoft and Google, on Wednesday also reported sales increases in their cloud computing business, with all companies pointing to adoption of AI services as the main driver.

headline: Amazon reports higher sales and earnings for 3Q, helped by its fast-growing web services business
summary: Amazon posted higher fiscal third quarter profit and sales compared with a year ago, fueled by accelerating growth in its cloud computing business and strong spending by its customers looking for low prices at a time when inflation is resurging.  Analysts are analyzing Amazon's results, along with other retailers' earnings performances, to get insight into how shoppers are spending heading into the holiday season and how the online behemoth is managing cost increases from President Donald Trump's tariffs.  Amazon delivered better-than-expected 20% growth for AWS, following a 17.5% growth in the fiscal second quarter.

content.title: Amazon reports higher sales and earnings for 3Q, helped by its fast-growing web services business
content.summary: Amazon posted higher fiscal third quarter profit and sales compared with a year ago, fueled by accelerating growth in its cloud computing business and strong spending by its customers looking for low prices at a time when inflation is resurging.  Analysts are analyzing Amazon's results, along with other retailers' earnings performances, to get insight into how shoppers are spending heading into the holiday season and how the online behemoth is managing cost increases from President Donald Trump's tariffs.  Amazon delivered better-than-expected 20% growth for AWS, following a 17.5% growth in the fiscal second quarter.

headline: Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q3, Stock Soars
summary: Cloud computing and online retail behemoth Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) reported Q3 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 13.4% year on year to $180.2 billion. The company expects next quarter’s revenue to be around $209.5 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $1.95 per share was 25.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q3, Stock Soars
content.summary: Cloud computing and online retail behemoth Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) reported Q3 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 13.4% year on year to $180.2 billion. The company expects next quarter’s revenue to be around $209.5 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $1.95 per share was 25.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Zuckerberg Drops Two Spots in Billionaire Ranks as Meta AI Plans Shake Investors
summary: Meta’s stock fell 11% — the most since 2022 — after the company said it was going to issue the biggest investment-grade bond offering of the year to boost spending on artificial intelligence research, dropping Zuckerberg’s net worth to $235.2 billion, according to the wealth index.  Zuckerberg’s $29.2 billion drop was the fourth-largest one-day market-driven decline ever recorded by Bloomberg’s wealth index.

content.title: Zuckerberg Drops Two Spots in Billionaire Ranks as Meta AI Plans Shake Investors
content.summary: Meta’s stock fell 11% — the most since 2022 — after the company said it was going to issue the biggest investment-grade bond offering of the year to boost spending on artificial intelligence research, dropping Zuckerberg’s net worth to $235.2 billion, according to the wealth index.  Zuckerberg’s $29.2 billion drop was the fourth-largest one-day market-driven decline ever recorded by Bloomberg’s wealth index.

headline: Payroll Processors Continue to Slide. What the Charts of Paylocity Holding, Paycom Software Say.
summary: Employment-related news may be sending an early warning that the labor market is losing steam, a precursor to a recession.  Meta Platforms Amazon,  Microsoft Intel Corp United Parcel Service Applied Materials, and Target are just some of the names disclosing job cuts in recent weeks.  Shares of payroll processors, staffing firms, and the like—companies that often lead employment trends—have begun to weaken.

content.title: Payroll Processors Continue to Slide. What the Charts of Paylocity Holding, Paycom Software Say.
content.summary: Employment-related news may be sending an early warning that the labor market is losing steam, a precursor to a recession.  Meta Platforms Amazon,  Microsoft Intel Corp United Parcel Service Applied Materials, and Target are just some of the names disclosing job cuts in recent weeks.  Shares of payroll processors, staffing firms, and the like—companies that often lead employment trends—have begun to weaken.

headline: Amazon Earnings: By the Numbers
summary: Here's what is driving the stock from the company's earnings report.  Net profit rose 39% to $21.2 billion.  Revenue from Amazon Web Services, the source of much of the company’s profits, climbed 20% in the three-month period.

content.title: Amazon Earnings: By the Numbers
content.summary: Here's what is driving the stock from the company's earnings report.  Net profit rose 39% to $21.2 billion.  Revenue from Amazon Web Services, the source of much of the company’s profits, climbed 20% in the three-month period.

headline: Roku sees deceleration in quarterly revenue growth, shares fall
summary: The company expects revenue growth of 12% for the current quarter, below the 14% reported in the third quarter and the 15% growth in the second quarter.  The streaming platform, whose stock has risen over 34% so far this year, also sees a slowdown in growth at its platform segment — which includes ad sales and subscriptions — to 15% in the fourth quarter.  While ad spending has been shifting from traditional television to streaming, advertisers have remained cautious with their budgets amid economic uncertainty, creating a challenging environment for platforms dependent on ad revenue.

content.title: Roku sees deceleration in quarterly revenue growth, shares fall
content.summary: The company expects revenue growth of 12% for the current quarter, below the 14% reported in the third quarter and the 15% growth in the second quarter.  The streaming platform, whose stock has risen over 34% so far this year, also sees a slowdown in growth at its platform segment — which includes ad sales and subscriptions — to 15% in the fourth quarter.  While ad spending has been shifting from traditional television to streaming, advertisers have remained cautious with their budgets amid economic uncertainty, creating a challenging environment for platforms dependent on ad revenue.

headline: Amazon stock surges after blowing past Q3 estimates
summary: Amazon (AMZN) blew past Wall Street's expectations for its third quarter earnings (gains of $1.95 per share vs. estimates of $1.58) and net revenue figures ($180.17 billion vs. estimates of $177.82 billion). The stock initially surged by as much as 10% in extended hours on this earnings release at the time of this video's posting. Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton dives into Amazon's earnings release after Thursday's closing bell. Also catch Intelligent Alpha founder Doug Clinton explain why he doesn't invest in Amazon. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

content.description:
Amazon (AMZN) blew past Wall Street's expectations for its third quarter earnings (gains of $1.95 per share vs. estimates of $1.58) and net revenue figures ($180.17 billion vs. estimates of $177.82 billion). The stock initially surged by as much as 10% in extended hours on this earnings release at the time of this video's posting.

Also catch Intelligent Alpha founder Doug Clinton explain why he doesn't invest in Amazon.

headline: Amazon shares soar as cloud growth beats expectations
summary: (Reuters) -Amazon's cloud revenue rose at the fastest clip in nearly three years, helping the company forecast quarterly sales above estimates and driving its shares up 14% in after-market trading.  The company projected increased capital spending next year.  Amazon's rally in extended trading lifted the company's market value by about $330 billion.

content.title: Amazon shares soar as cloud growth beats expectations
content.summary: (Reuters) -Amazon's cloud revenue rose at the fastest clip in nearly three years, helping the company forecast quarterly sales above estimates and driving its shares up 14% in after-market trading.  The company projected increased capital spending next year.  Amazon's rally in extended trading lifted the company's market value by about $330 billion.

headline: Freight and manufacturing layoffs sweep across supply chain
summary: A wave of job cuts spanning logistics providers, packaging plants and manufacturers is impacting the supply chain entering 2026. The post Freight and manufacturing layoffs sweep across supply chain appeared first on FreightWaves.
